item.title: Transport Server v0.0.4.5
item.description:
Product: Transport Server v0.0.4.5
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 08 Aug 2025 15:11:02 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Server used for scripting and performing asynchronous transport measurments.

Release Notes: 0.0.4
- fix Close transport VIs
- fix JSON formatting for set/appendExptParam

item.title: Transport Server v0.0.2.3
item.description:
Product: Transport Server v0.0.2.3
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Wed, 06 Aug 2025 21:00:23 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Server used for scripting and performing asynchronous transport measurments.

Release Notes: 0.0.2
#123 update install location
#124 remove dynamic image feature
#125: add buttons to open (and close) the transport VIs
#126: add getStatus API (and setStatus private command)
#127: run LockTimeDelay only one time then exit the loop
#128: add stopTransport button to FP
#129: open Transport VIs asynchronously
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.24.0.20
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.24.0.20
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:53:46 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462).
- This version is configured to handle multiple cards for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO.
- The analog outputs can be configured to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with (swept) DC offsets.
- Each of the analog inputs can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.24.0]
#111 fix missing items from palette
#112 add DC limit feature

#### Dependencies
- Please ensure that [Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784) is installed. The bitness must match the application you're targeting.
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Control Experiment v1.3.4.20
item.description:
Product: Control Experiment v1.3.4.20
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 25 Jul 2025 12:53:38 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
- Control Experiment.vi
- provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device
- record how the lockin is connected to the device
- configure the Krohn Hite amplifier
- set the base path for saving data
- configure peripheral instruments
- APIs for recording sample data, instrument status

Release Notes: [1.3.4]
#119 fix issue in which Comments are not written to TDMS files
#120 update packed dependencies
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.23.0.18
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.23.0.18
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Thu, 24 Jul 2025 18:14:08 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462).
- This version is configured to handle multiple cards for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO.
- The analog outputs can be configured to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with (swept) DC offsets.
- Each of the analog inputs can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.23.0]
#108 build with updated LV-Data library to use microsconds resolution when logging to postgres
#110 Update filtering VIs:
1. fix timestamp drift issue by not replacing timestamps (as DFD library does)
2. implement forward and reverse low pass filtering to eliminate phase shift (zero phase filtering)
3. note that filter orders are now 2*n

#### Dependencies
- Please ensure that [Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784) is installed. The bitness must match the application you're targeting.
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462).
- This version is configured to handle multiple cards for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO.
- The analog outputs can be configured to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with (swept) DC offsets.
- Each of the analog inputs can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.23.0]
#108 build with updated LV-Data library to use microsconds resolution when logging to postgres
#110 Update filtering VIs:
1. fix timestamp drift issue by not replacing timestamps (as DFD library does)
2. implement forward and reverse low pass filtering to eliminate phase shift (zero phase filtering)
3. note that filter orders are now 2*n

#### Dependencies
